column4: how can I see what is my installed version of ntfs-3g? At the same price... does anyone know which is the ntfs-3g version installed by default in gutsy?
FN keys in Sony VAIO? Anybody?
well, not so recent, it's a Pentium M 740... two years maybe, FJ1S
so I have no chance to configure FN keys... that's the meaning, not?
might be worth googling sonylaptop and ubuntu
yes, that is what I did many times... with no results. There are solutions, but not with my settings (people uses sony-laptop module, but I use sonypi and sonyacpi...)
Are you trying to config them to lanch applications? Or just to make your screen brightness alterable?
It would be enough for me being able to set the brightness level and, if possible, sound volume
you could send it to sleep from the command line maybe
Ok, but what I want is to avoid it to stop the way it does now. There is a big noise from the 'yet spinning' disk when laptop turns down, I I think it's not healthy for device
probably it just parking the heads...

sorry for my english, maybe I don't express this correctly... In win, it stops spinning when I ask Windows to remove it. In Ubuntu, it never stops, even when I umount it. This is what I mean. And it makes some strange noises when stops suddenly
